paragraphs.text: If you take Westbrook back to 1962, he’s only 6'1. Yes, he’s still an outlier for speed. He shoots 38% if you give him shots. In the area where most of the shots were taken (3–10 feet) in 1962 Westbrook has a career shooting percentage of 32.6%.

a4ee73e38bac.title: Today’s players are far superior to players in the 60s, both skill-wise and athletically.

paragraphs.text: Today’s players are far superior to players in the 60s, both skill-wise and athletically. Nearly everyone in today’s NBA would be considered a physical freak if transported back to the 60s. Rudy Gobert wasn’t even an All-Star this year. If you drop him in the NBA in 1962, he might be the MVP. And playing against these superior modern athletes…

paragraphs.text:
Your whole analysis is wrong. Your extrapolation of stats is laughable. Apparently you have never heard of the word “defense”. 
Westbrook is accomplishing his triple doubles while going against other freak athletes every single night. On a game filled with monsters, Westbrook might be the faster and more athletic of them all. 
Now put Oscar Robertson…
